TopicTitle: Are there Biomes at Duna and other Planets?

Articles.Content:
hello,

there are biomes on other planetes in patch 0.24?

Edited July 20, 2014 by Vanamonde
No. As of 0.24, only Kerbin, the Mun, and Minmus have biomes. But it's planned to add more.

hello,

there are biomes on other planetes in patch 0.24?

GOOD GOD MAN! please title threads like these as a question next time, i read it as a factual statement and got so excited!
Eve and Laythe have separate biomes for land and water though.

GOOD GOD MAN! please title threads like these as a question next time, i read it as a factual statement and got so excited!

Yeah me too I thought someone had discovered a hidden update which was not announced.

Eve and Laythe have separate biomes for land and water though.

Not true. Water isn't considered a separate biome. Water is simply detected as "splash down" which generates different science. For all practical purposes though, yes, you want to explore land and water whenever possible.

Not true. Water isn't considered a separate biome. Water is simply detected as "splash down" which generates different science. For all practical purposes though, yes, you want to explore land and water whenever possible.

Id love some fluff text so we can know if those oceans are really water, or even have traces of h2o. i think i read somewhere laythe needs either an amonia ocean, or a super super salty h2o ocean to make sense. idk what eves ocean could be.

GOOD GOD MAN! please title threads like these as a question next time, i read it as a factual statement and got so excited!

I did too. I can only assume that the OPs first language isn't English. In many languages, a question is said as a statement of fact just with a question mark at the end. The switching round of the words "There are" and "Are there" to change the sentence from statement to a question is one of the quirks of English.
Pretty sure Duna has two biomes? Polar regions and normal?

Pretty sure Duna has two biomes? Polar regions and normal?

not for SCIENCE purposes. only visual

Technically yes, it does have a biome, but only one. I'm sure this is not really what the question is getting at. Kerbin, Mun, and Minmus are currently the only celestial bodies with multiple biomes.

Additionally, as was posted, the biomes can have more than one state. Landed and Splashed count as different "states" over the biome, as does Flight Above, Low Orbit, and High Orbit. Those aren't different biomes though.
I have slightly modified the title of this thread so that it doesn't sound like an announcement of new biomes.

I cannot proceed in my space program until biomes are added to another celestial body (preferably Duna). Unlike NASA - the Kerbals do not sell their program out to contracts, Squad. WE MUST HAVE BIOMES
I'd like biomes on Moho, Tylo, and Duna.
